text: Hello! I'm a young .NET developer and automation engineer living in Santeramo in Colle, Italy.
I graduated at *, where I grew as a student and as a professional, gaining insight in fields as control theory, robotics and artificial intelligence.
My goals are learning, growing and innovating. I try to take the most from each experience I make, and to make my initiative spirit emerge.
Outside the workplace, you may find me *, * or *. Or maybe walking *.

preview.noprojects: There are no projects to show for this skill right now, but how about starting the first one together? More points for open source projects.

research.name: Research assistant
research.descr: I developed an optimization module of transport missions of heavy-duty trucks. The algorithm reconstructs the street graph from a set of geographical points and computes, using the truck model, the most ecological route and the recommended speed profile to reduce CO2 emissions, taking account of traffic and weather conditions, as well as delivery constraints.

tutoring.name: Students' tutor
tutoring.descr: I supported first-year students, helping them with exams, easing their relationship with professors and leading them into university life.

backend.name: Back end developer
backend.descr: I took responsibility of the full back end (ASP.NET Core) lifecycle, including designing, development, testing, documentation, deployment and maintenance. At the same time, I researched on cooperative control of autonomous vehicles, collaborating with the scientific director of the lab and writing papers.

software.name: Software developer
software.descr: Back-end development of enterprise solutions. Design of distributed and scalable microservice architectures. Development and mantainance of foundation libraries. Strong usage of workflow orchestrators and the Actor Model.

thesis.value: Analysis of minimization algorithms for determining the optimum path of heavy-duty trucks .

descr.value: Control Theory, Industrial Automation, Applied Mechanics, Electrical Communications, Electric Machines.

thesis.value: Analysis and design of control algorithms for autonomous vehicles at urban intersections.

descr.value: Robotics, Electric Drives, Estimation and Control of Dynamical Systems, Model Predictive Control.

descr.audioengineer: Simple application, born as university project. It offered some functions as audio acquisition, spectrogram generation and real-time FFT. It includes a voice recognition algorithm, based on neural networks and genetic algorithms, capable of recognizing vowels.
descr.voicenotes: This app was commissioned by a friend graduating in speech therapy. It was intended as a proof-of-concept of his thesis work, and it was focused on the diagnostic of speech diseases. It can manage the patients' medical records, allowing to insert medical history, diagnosis with images and videos, as well as other speech and posture evaluation parameters.
descr.magicbet: My very first project. It manages the amount on money to stake on sports betting, following an algorithm, called MagicBet, designed by myself.
descr.supermario: A simple Super Mario Clone written in pure Java, as low-level videogame programming exercise.
descr.portfolio: It's the website you're browsing right now! No caption needed. üòÅ
descr.generatorkit: Work-in-progress tool, which aim is to simplify the development of .NET source generators, enabling the use of reflection and code execution at compile time.

descr.text: In this page you will find some music videos of mine. Not many so far, but I hope to add some more soon!

questions: How long have you been playing?
answers: I play the classical guitar. I got my degree from Conservatory in 2019.
I got my first guitar as a present for my 10th birthday. However, I started actually playing it only some years later, to get prepared for the admission in Conservatory.
I've been self-learning piano during the years, but I never got beyond "Happy birthday". I've been taking singing lessons for 4 years, but I quit when I started university.

text: The COVID-19 lockdown in Spring 2020 was a time of great uncertainty. But, thanks to the will to conquer fear - or maybe thanks to the boatload of spare time we all had - it also was a season of great creativity. For a long time, I had been having in mind the idea of realizing a split-screen cover, so I decided that was the right moment to do it: under the hashtag
(#stayhome) the La La Land Medley is born.

disney-medley.text: The La La Land Medley was a starting point since where I decided to work on other ideas. I grew up with Disney movies, falling in love, like many, with their animated movies' soundtracks. And so, the Disney Medley is born: 9 copies of myself perform a mashup of 8 songs from 7 films in 6 minutes. And the karaoke comes for free!

descr.welcome: This is the page about my aerial photos and videos.
descr.text: Here you will find some of them, which I shot with my loyal Mavic Pro, buyed in 2018.

snow.text: The year 2019 began with an exceptional snowstorm that turned Santeramo in Colle, my hometown, completely white. The snowstorm was of such proportions that the town got itself isolated for a couple of days, covered by a meter of snow. When the storm stopped, however, we were left with an amazing sight, something that had not been seen in years: what better occasion for my first video shot if not a little town on top of the Murge plateau enveloped in a white blanket?
